title: [Complete] Ranked season badges are out!
body:
**Update: All badges have been given out! If your badges are missing or you feel you have incorrect badges, please file a ticket with support [here](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new).**

Hey everyone!

We’re rolling out ranked season badges to the boards right now! Please be aware this can take a while because of the sheer number of players receiving them, but we’ll update this thread when we’ve finished. You’ll see your ranked badges for all seasons (not just the most recent) in your boards profile or when you hover over your name in the boards.

As a reminder, you’ll get a badge for each season you finished Gold or higher (except Season 2, where you had to be Platinum or higher). 

Thanks for your patience, and we’ll see you on the boards!

replies.body: thats great, now, when ya gonna fix transfers
Don't be a jerk
Yay, more rewards the majority of players don't get...

> Yay, more rewards the majority of players don't get...

Guess you just need to get better then?
Flawed logic is flawed.
Not really flawed, just accept that we suck
No, it is flawed. The system is designed so that most people that play won't get any rewards. If everyone gets better, then no more people get rewards.
That's what a competition is. If everyone get the reward( or even the majority) what's the point in working to get better?

I will counter: if I'm not getting a reward, what's the point of working to get better?^  This is why there are supposed to be *staggered* rewards.  The people at the bottom shouldn't feel like they got nothing, especially if the majority of the people are there. We should get something that feels *worthwhile* for playing, and the people that succeed should get increasingly *more* worthwhile rewards.

^This is something I actively felt, in Bronze V. There was no way I was going to get all the way to silver for the next reward, so why bother?

Because a game is meant to be fun. The first reason to keep playing, to keep trying to improve is because you enjoy playing the game, because you want to learn new champions, because you have friends that you enjoy playing with. If you're somebody who finds the game fun **and** then you're somebody who finds competition fun, playing ranked and striving for Silver, Gold, Plat, Diamond, Master, Challenger--that starts as an intrinsic goal, Riot has added some extrinsic goals (victorious skins, banners, badges, load screen boarders, ward skins, icons) but a real competitive nature needs to start from you and something you enjoy when it comes to a game.

Obviously there was no way you were going to get out of Bronze 5 because you only wanted out of Bronze for the next reward. If all you wanted was that reward you're often going to talk yourself out of that purpose unless that reward satisfies a basic human need or a very important secondary human need. Riot Games isn't going to give you food and shelter, they aren't going to give their whole userbase money, and practically anything else is a reward that if it's a long term task/goal (as a season lasts almost a year) is not really going to satisfy an extrinsically motivated person. 

There are still staggered rewards, obviously the lowest tier of rewards (bronze) isn't going to get a huge reward (they got summoner icons) because anybody can get into bronze by going Nami jungle 10 games in a row and 1v1ing baron every game until you go 0/39/2. Maybe Silver doesn't have a huge reward but they still have more rewards than Bronze and to put it this way you don't hit the 50th percentile until like Silver 3. SIlver 5 (which still gets Silver rewards) is still a pretty low skill level in comparison to the 'average' of ranked players.

This is a big post. 

Response to first paragraph: Playing the game for fun is not the same as playing the game to win. You don't climb just from randomly playing 100 games; if you do that, you might be lucky to go up a division. You climb by going on winning streaks, and that takes either the kind of luck you only experience once every 100 games or playing a champion that can carry pretty much any game. Then you need to actually carry every game. That's not fun. That's work. I happen to *like* playing Soraka and Miss Fortune, even if I can't carry with them. 

Next Paragraph: What does that have to do with anything? The rewards, and simply being better than other people, are the only reason people climb. O.o 

Third Paragraph: No, they aren't "staggered", because the population ratio to rewards is off. There are around 1.6 million people that play NA; these numbers are approximate. See next post.

I was 10/3 with Raka this week (until I got into promos and had 3 AFKs in a row) now I'm like 11/5, so sad. You can carry as pretty much any champion in B5 (well I'm in B1 but still).

Yes and no, some people find competitive play to be fun. You didn't get to level 30 without playing the game for fun, but I'm sure you also played the game to win games. You didn't just lose 10 games in a row and be like 'lol that's okay that was super fun' you were playing A) for fun and B) for win. If you're playing a game for fun then a game can fit both of those circumstances, if you're not playing for fun then it can't.

as for the next paragraph it has a lot to do with **everything**. The reason you didn't get strive for Silver, no matter what you claim, is because you weren't intrinsically motivated to get there. Anybody who aims to climb a ladder like that needs to be the kind of person who is motivated *by themselves* and not by outer influences to actually do well. A reward only motivates somebody to try harder if it is considered to be a *simple task* like offering a child $5 to do the dishes will get them to do the dishes. A reward will not **fully** motivate a person to try harder for a task that is considered a *complex task* as climbing the ranks of LoL is. Going from Bronze to Silver is a huge time commitment that requires knowledge of in multiple areas. As such **it doesn't matter what League of Legends was offering a person to get go from B5-S5 because you aren't going to be any more likely to get there**. Aka the reason you didn't get to Silver, or even try to get to Silver, was because you weren't motivated yourself to get to Silver, you were looking for some sort of reward from Riot to get to Silver. That only works in very high Elo where they are competing for money and money helps people satisfy their basic needs for living.

>  We should get something that feels worthwhile for playing, and the people that succeed should get increasingly more worthwhile rewards....This is something I actively felt, in Bronze V. There was no way I was going to get all the way to silver for the next reward, so why bother?

That's what that paragraph was responding to, when you mentioned getting to Silver you said you weren't going to make it **to the next reward** and therefore you had **no reason** to try. I was also responding to this:

> if I'm not getting a reward, what's the point of working to get better?

because like I've said in the longterm (aka a year long season) a **reward** won't motivate people who are motivated for the reward. Only people who want to get better and are playing for reasons inside themselves are going to get better. Aka the reward Riot gives is a nice bonus but it shouldn't be a big deal.

11/5, as in, almost half. Not gonna climb. Enough said.

>If you're playing a game for fun then a game can fit both of those circumstances, if you're not playing for fun then it can't.

This is true. This is where the 50% win rate comes in. Not sacrificing fun for the sake of winning while also trying to win. 

Anyway, I  see what you're saying now. However, as irrelevant as you think the reward system is, it is still unfair. It should still be reformed regardless of how little "motivation" it gives. Why can't a fair distribution of people get the cherry on top?

Your argument could just as easily be a response to the person I was responding to.

Like I said I was 10/3 with her this week before I hit promos and had an AFK ADC 2 games in a row. I gained about 250lp in less than a week, for me that was a good enough climb.

> Anyway, I see what you're saying now. However, as irrelevant as you think the reward system is, it is still unfair. It should still be reformed regardless of how little "motivation" it gives. Why can't a fair distribution of people get the cherry on top?

Because you start to get the cherry on top as soon as you hit Silver, which is more than 50% of the people who play ranked?

If you are playing ranked and it is taking you a long time to climb, bit by slow bit i don't think you can blame the system for that. You're saying that it takes 100 games to move up a bit. I thought the way you did for a while. I was in B4 in season 3 and thought I was good enough to be in silver. Except I realized that the reason I was only barely moving up was because I wasn't really examining my play and seeing where I made mistakes. 

This season I played a bunch and I really improved quite a bit. Season 4 I started in B5 with 0 LP. It took me 115 games to get to S5. I noticed a lot of differences with my playstyle. Before I lost my lane about 30% of the time went even 40% and won my lane 30% (rough guess) and said, see I'm not feeding or anything, I'm doing better than those guys. Really though that just meant I was about even, because if you assume everyone in the same rank is doing the same, that means 1-2 teammates should be losing lane every game. This season though I won lane 70% (when playing mid, stats vary for other lanes, but fairly good) went even 25% and lost 5%. I moved up pretty quickly and was able to hit S5 before the end of the season. It's about getting consistency, understanding what your mistakes are so you have more A games.

I hope this means something to you and others working through it. I wish you luck in improving your league of legends play :).

P.S. Leaguecraft101 youtube series is long but worth the time.

That's exactly what my post said, in different words. Either you climb over a very long time with a lot of luck or you force yourself to get better.

And to address your other post: Some people do in fact view silver banners as insults. These are gold/plat/diamond players that enjoy being judgmental. *shrug* Can't control what people think.

> Either you climb over a very long time with a lot of luck **or you force yourself to get better.**


Isn't that the point?  Ronaldo isn't a great soccer player because he has a lot of luck.  Took him a LONG time to get as good as he is.  Don't you think he "forced himself to get better"?  That's with anyone and anything in competitive play.  Real sports or e-sports.  You don't sit back and hope to be challenger just by complaining on boards about how you don't get a banner to show off that bronze.  Hell, in fact, I was embarrassed to load a game knowing everyone on my team has a boarder except little old bronze me.  It was time for a change.

Well I'm glad this isn't just another case of someone complaining about the system is messed up. :)

Hehe, I'm a noob xD but I guess there is still a certain amount of pride in that. Maybe what Riot should do is give special rewards to people who work their way out of bronze. It'd be extra to just being in silver at the end of the season. To show people who were in the lowest rung but improved themselves.

What a fair scaling would be:

Bottom 10% just get summoner's icons: 160,000 people (currently that's B3+B4+B5)

Next 15% get banners: 240,000 people 

>so the bottom 25% do not get cool stuff. 

Next 15% get free champion (but not victorious skin): 240,000 people 

Next 25% get Victorious skin: 400,000 people  

Next 10% get 2nd summoner's icon: 160,000 people 

>so between 25% and 75%, you get something worthwhile. 

Next 5% get 2nd free champion: 80,000 people

Next 10% get Second Victorious skin: 160,000 people

Next 10% a third special summoner's icon 

>So the top 25% get extra special, rare rewards. Yay.

> Next 15% get free champion (but not victorious skin): 240,000 people

I have friends who own all the champions, that's not a reward at all to them and I'm sure for a lot of the people above that tier they've been playing long enough to own most if not all the champions as well.

> What a fair scaling would be:

that's a fair scaling to you. You can go 2/8 in your promos and still get a banner with your 'fair scaling'. I think the scaling as it is right now is pretty fair. Bronze people get icons and since **anyone can be bronze** they don't need any fancy boarders** why would you want a boarder/load in screen exclaiming 'hey guys I'm playing at the same skill level that anybody who has been playing league for a month is considered to be'. 

Most of these rewards are meant to show off your status of the previous season. Banners, badges, load in screens. If you're bronze why do you want to have a big bronze emblem on your hover icon to show that you achieved what somehow who has never won a ranked game can get to.
That is kinda the idea of a reward, you have to earn it.....
Hundreds of hours from 800,000+ people? Pft, that earned them nothing. That's not enough for a free champion and a nice skin once a year.
To be  fair you are advocating for a participation award. While noble, it doesn't really signify actual achievement.

Is there any way to look up someone's Season 3 rank? LoLNexus and LoLKing used to show that information, but no longer do; I  was told that Riot's API had changed and that information had (apparently?) been erased, but if badges are being handed out then presumably it's available somewhere.

I'm not asking so that I can complain about my solo queue team being "Bronze baddies in S3". I'm asking mostly for **[Factions](http://LeagueFactions.net)** balancing and scoring purposes. (I did some stats on winrates of various ranked-tier matchups, e.g. how often a team of three Silvers and two Bronzes beats a team of five Bronzes, and we use that data to adjust how many points a faction gains from wins and loses from defeats. Obviously, if an all-Diamond Demacian team beats an all-Bronze Noxian team, it should be worth few if any points.) We had used the higher of S3 and S4 rank to balance Factions matches, which are organized as custom games, but we've been forced to switch to S4 only after the API change. It's kind of a problem, because there are some people who were highly ranked in S3 but didn't bother to play much Ranked in S4.

Any chance that the API will be updated to allow lookup of S3 rank again?
